to do so, we need a parent shell. The call to getActiveWorkbenchWindow() is 
returning null.

Fixed.

The change is now in CVS HEAD. This bug is due to the Eclipse 3.0 change of 
launching in the background instead of the UI thread. Getting the active window 
from the workbench is a UI operation and will fail (return null) if not called 
from the UI thread. Switched the call to the correct thread.
